CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper July 20, 1957, pg. A1, reads: "Attend Peace Parley - Among the persons attending a one-week institute on the 'Quaker Approach to Contemporary Problems' at Chatham College were these persons who took time out to visit the Courier plant. The are, left to right, front row: Margaret Salameh, Dr. Dorothy Hutchinson, zoologist and leader in the Women's International League for Peace and Freedom; Randa Salameh and her mother, Mrs. Yvonne Salameh; and back row, left to right: Jacob E. G. Dento of Accra, Ghana; Priscilla Enderson, a citizen of the United States and also Norway; Shukri Salameh, and Dr. Calvin Keene of the Howard School of Religion. The Salamehs are from Trans-Jordan and are known as Palestine Arabs. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Peace conference attendees, front row from left: Margaret Salameh, Dr. Dorothy Hutchinson, Randa Salameh and her mother Yvonne Salameh; back row: Jacob E. G. Dento, Priscilla Enderson, Shukri Salameh, and Dr. Calvin Keene posed in front of Pittsburgh Courier newspaper building, Centre Avenue, Hill District
